page.title: 09DODWORTH
page.content: Our area is farmland and contained very little litter.The houses are terraced,there is an estate of bungalows and an Old People's Home.There are only a few public houses in this area. The farmlands have crops which are used for cereals,there are rough grazing areas too.Some is used for public footpaths which would have been used by the colliery workers for getting to and from the colliery.The countryside is spoilt by the dismantled railway lines and the old derelict mine. The survey ended in Hood Green,a small but pretty village which has not suffered form litter and vandalism.This is in spite of the fact that it is not far from Dodworth and Barnsley.A village well worth a visit.
